claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).
explanation: A multi‐panel forest plot showing relative vaccine effectiveness (with 95% CIs) across subgroups (cardiovascular disease, respiratory disease, cardiorespiratory disease, obesity, diabetes, any of the above) for outcomes: PCR‐confirmed influenza, hospitalization for PCR‐confirmed influenza, and hospitalization for community‐acquired pneumonia. The x‐axis is percentage effectiveness from –50% to +55%, with points and horizontal lines representing subgroup estimates. The figure does not name the vaccines being compared (no mention of Flublok or Fluarix) and thus doesn't support the claim that Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard‐dose vaccine). Note: Analysis limited to visible labels; if vaccine names appear elsewhere in the document they are not shown in this figure.
